name: Fear the Reaper: Bard 20 / CoT 10 / RDD 10
author: EasternPromises

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
If you have been following my posts you may have noticed I've been attempting to pound out a combo with Bard song and combat maneuvers. I still wanted comparable AB and saves. So here we are with a Bard 20 CoT 10 RDD 10 split that looks like it has everything. Currently it's a two handed flanker with stealth, though the obvious scimitar/TS + disc was the main version. I raised his dex a little so that a belt of agility + cat's grace would make chain shirt a good pick, lowering the ACP to -2.

I haven't been able to fully reproduce the taunt+expertise combo here in EE, but I can say the combat cancel with taunt on the stack works great, no expertise required.

The idea for this guy is to sneak up to opponents with invisibility or stealth, curse song (doesn't break invis currently), IKD, Taunt cancel, ID/IDK. Lowering your opponent's discipline by 8 and buffing your own attack by 2, not to mention the -11 AC they will suffer, makes for more consistent maneuver attempts. KD immune opponents tend to be so because they lack discipline, so disarm away.

Besides your maneuvers you still have 20 levels of bard utility, dev crit, and 44 AB. I hope to tackle both melee and mages alike with this one. The "safe" version uses a shield and scimitar and has discipline and spot. I'm open to any ideas you have, I've been struggling with this one for a while.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
So I combined this build with true strike scroll for my opener. So far a 90% KD/Disarm rate. For 125 gold.

50 Buffed AB + 20 from TS + 8 Discipline removed from Curse Song is a devastating 78+1d20 DC discipline check against IKD or a medium weapon disarm. Worst case scenario I am fighting another buffed RDD with super STR and discipline, for a total of 63 disc, I still like my odds especially if they use a scimitar. Obviously someone that has all that and also disc buffing gear is more resistant to the combo but I do have some good damage output and AC reduction options.
